data.text:
Adobe Statistics: Adobe Inc. is an American multinational computer software firm, known initially as Adobe Systems Incorporated. Charles M. Geschke, and John E. Warnock, founded the company in Delaware in 1982, with its headquarters in San Jose, California, USA.

The company provides media solutions and digital marketing and operates through three segments: Digital Media, Publishing & Advertising, and Digital Experience. Digital Media provides creative cloud services that allow members to download the most recent versions of Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, and Adobe Premiere Pro. The Digital Experience segment contributes solutions including analytics, social media marketing, targeting, optimization, digital experience management, and cross-channel campaign administration. It also provides premium video delivery and monetization.

The company has been a leader in publishing software that can create and publish different content. The publishing segment delivers legacy products and services in eLearning, web application development, and technical document publishing. It also includes high-end printing. It includes photography, graphics, illustration, motion pictures, animation, and print. Adobe’s most popular products are Adobe Acrobat Reader, Adobe Photoshop photo editing software, Adobe Illustrator vector-based illustration software, and Portable Doc Format (PDF), as well as a variety of tools primarily used for creating audio-visual content, editing it, and publishing it. Adobe Creative Suite was a bundle of its products. It evolved into Adobe Creative Cloud, a subscription-based software service (SaaS).

Business Strategy:

Adobe focuses on providing a freemium model and easy access to premium features of their products which ensure customer engagement.

Innovation in business models and expansion of customer base are the key drivers of the company.

Adobe’s product growth has increased its market presence owing to the rise in the number of users. Adobe offers monthly access to its premium features as well as content which has increased its engagement with its customers.

The company grabbing the opportunity of rapid digitalization. Collaboration boosts creative productivity and the company’s stakeholder growth.

The less number of competitors and alternatives to adobe’s products are the key drivers of the company which has made it popular and irreplaceable.

Revenue Growth:

The company’s ongoing string of innovative innovations is supported by strong research-and-development departments that the company invests well over a million dollars annually. Recently, the company expanded its market into the cloud market. Its main products are the Adobe Creative Cloud as well as the Document Cloud. Adobe’s Creative Cloud has been a trusted name in the tech industry for decades. Its ability to adapt and invent new technology is evident in its over 10,000,000 subscribers. And, according to forecasts, this number will continue growing in the future.

Statistics:

Annual Revenue of Adobe Inc. from 2012 to 2021 (in millions of US$)

Adobe Inc. reported a company-record revenue of 15.79 billion US$ for its 2021 fiscal. The company’s overall revenue has increased by almost 16 billion US$ in the six years since 2015.

Annual Global Revenue of Adobe Inc. From Fiscal Year 2018 to 2021, by Segment (in billion US$)

Digital Media is Adobe Inc.’s largest business segment among others. Its revenues exceeded 11 billion US$ in the 2021 fiscal year. Digital Media also includes solutions like the Creative and Document Cloud offerings.

Annual revenue of Adobe Inc. from the Fiscal Year 2018 to 2021, by type (in billion US$)

Adobe Inc. earns most of its revenue from the subscription business. The company had net sales of 14.57 Billion dollars in fiscal 2021. Adobe has made significant changes to its business model, shifting from software licensing to subscription-based. The focus is now on cloud offerings.

Research and Development Expenditure of Adobe Inc. from 2012 to 2021 (in millions of US$)

This graph shows Adobe’s annual research-and-development (R&D) expenditures from the fiscal year 2012 through 2021. The company spent 2.54 billion U.S. Dollars on R&D in the most recent fiscal year.

Annual Revenue of Adobe Inc. from the Fiscal Year 2018 to 2021, by Region (in billion US$)

Adobe Inc. gets more than half of its revenue from the Americas, which was worth nine billion US$ in fiscal 2021. Adobe has made significant changes to its business model, shifting from software licensing to subscription-based. A major focus is now on cloud offerings.

Sales and Marketing Expenditure of Adobe Inc. from 2012 to 2021 (in millions of US$)

Adobe’s marketing and sales expenditures reached 4.3 million U.S. dollars in the fiscal year 2021. Adobe’s marketing and sales budgets have been increasing steadily over time as its businesses expand.

Recent Developments:

The year 2022

In March, Adobe expanded its partnership with BMW for the digital transformation of its sales and marketing division.

Adobe Sensei is Adobe’s Artificial Intelligence (AI) engine. In March, Adobe announced its new capabilities embedded within Adobe Experience Cloud.

Adobe announced a significant expansion of its partner network in March to provide more personal experiences for millions.

In March, Adobe extended its partnership with BMW Group for the digital transformation of the sales and marketing division of the latter.

In February, Adobe collaborated with LiveRamp to enable omnichannel people-based targeting and measurement.

In January, Adobe completed the acquisition of Abstract Notebooks, a software company.

The year 2021

In August, Adobe agreed to acquire Frame.io, a cloud-based video collaboration platform.

In September, Adobe and IBM entered into a collaboration to help prepare students from under-resourced backgrounds.

In November, Adobe and Monotype announced a partnership to make Fonts available to brands and creative professionals.

In December, Adobe agreed to acquire ContentCal.

In April, Adobe entered into a new multi-year collaboration with FedEx to drive E-commerce innovation.

In June, Adobe and LivePerson, Inc. announced the integration to help brands transform digital customer experience with conversational AI and personalization.
